attributes.action: Establish a dedicated Select Committee on Climate Change.
attributes.background: The rise in atmospheric CO2 since pre-industrial times has caused the climate to warm and start potentially irreversible changes to the environment
attributes.additional_details:
Examples of what Parliament needs to be able to challenge: 
1. Encouragement of aviation by approving the 3rd runway at Heathrow, and failure to tax aviation fuel appropriately. 
2. Endorsing and funding road infrastructure instead of on-shore and offshore wind turbine projects. 
3. Withdrawing support for the Swansea Bay Tidal Project lagoon. 
4. Nursing the new fracking industry(which releases the more hazardous methane as well as CO2) in spite of the need to keep fossil fuels underground.

attributes.action: Make the Highway Code compulsory in the national curriculum.
attributes.background:
The Highway Code is for everyone, not just licensed drivers.

Better education is required for All highway users to improve safety, awareness and misconceptions regarding highway safety for everyone and reduce the risk of incidents.

attributes.action: Stop the use of plastic milk bottles and return to glass bottles
attributes.background: Plastic milk bottles generate more toxic waste through recycling than the-using 100% recyclable glass milk bottles. Plastic milk bottles are just as bad as non-recyclable plastics and should be outlawed
attributes.additional_details: Refer to BBC program Blue Planet

attributes.action: Introduce pet ambulances
attributes.background: Many animals get injured, choke or die in their homes and the only option is to take them to the vets which may be too late&not nice to do. My dog choked on her own food and we had to do the hymic manoeuvre to get the food out of her system. If we didn’t it could of been too late. They should exist.

attributes.action: Ban the use of premium rate phone numbers completely.
attributes.background: These numbers are charged at a truly enormous rate and  there seems to be no legitimate need for these at all.

attributes.action: Devolve the suburban rail services in London to Transport for London.
attributes.background: The suburban railways in and around London that are operated by private companies are in a bad state with delays, cancellations and general bad quality of service. TfL operated services are some of the most reliable services in the country and have seen significant improvements since TfL took over.
attributes.additional_details:
TfL's plans for devolution released back in 2016 but rejected by the DfT, seemingly for no reason at all: https://tfl.gov.uk/corporate/about-tfl/how-we-work/planning-for-the-future/developing-the-rail-network
Chris Grayling's letter to Boris Johnson detailing how he was putting politics over devolution of service in London: https://www.theguardian.com/uk-news/2016/dec/07/chris-grayling-accused-of-putting-politics-over-people-in-rail-letter-leak

attributes.action: Require smoke masks in high rise buildings to assist evacuation in a fire.
attributes.background: The safe evacuation of a high rise building would be greatly improved if residents have access to emergency smoke and oxygen masks. The masks would reduce the potentially life threatening effects of smoke inhalation and improve the chances of safe evacuation. The masks cost less than £50 currently.
attributes.additional_details: Emergency fire services are provided with breathing apparatus to access buildings on fire. Clearly providing modest masks for residents exiting a building through smoke filled lobbies and staircases would be of benefit. Moreover the masks would provide additional reassurance to residents.

attributes.action: Ease the employment restrictions on asylum seekers.
attributes.background: Asylum seekers are restricted to jobs on the National Shortage Occupation List [SOL]; the reason behind their unemployed. The support they receive is inadequate for daily life [£5.39/day]; forcing them to live in poverty; relaxing the terms will make lives less vulnerable for those already in agony.
attributes.additional_details:
People seeking sanctuary in the UK could contribute £42m/year; if the work restrictions were non-existent. Millions are being spent to support destitute asylum seekers each year; this capital is possible to retain & make better use of. 

https://www.gov.uk/guidance/immigration-rules/immigration-rules-appendix-k-shortage-occupation-list

https://www.theguardian.com/uk-news/2018/oct/16/asylum-seekers-could-contribute-42m-to-uk-if-work-rules-relaxed

https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-wales-45100120

attributes.action: The government should stop ALL foreign aid now!
attributes.background: Issues at home are more important.
attributes.additional_details:
Foreign aid is given to India and they have a space programme 
Foreign aid is given to Pakistan, where Christians have been persecuted
Money should be spent on the NHS, pensions, policing etc.

attributes.action: Revoke bookmakers licences if they refuse to accept bets of £20 - £100
attributes.background: Bookmakers are limiting online customers to stakes of under £5 and often less than £1. They are also banning people from promotional offers. If a bookmaker won't accept a bet of £20 or a liability of £1,000 they should not be given a licence.
attributes.additional_details: These limits and restrictions are known as gubbing. This is when a bookmaker limits a customer to small stakes (often pennies) and bans customers from promotions or closes accounts. No explanation is given for this. They just say it is a trading decision. I believe it should be a condition of being granted a licence that all bookmakers accept bets with a liability of up to £1,000.

attributes.action: Require bookmakers to give the same offers to shop and internet customers.
attributes.background: Bookmakers have promotional offers that are only available to online customers. These should be available in shops. A lot of older people have been using shops since the early sixties, these people are not computer literate and they are being denied the offers that online account customers receive.

attributes.action: Reduce the drink-drive limit to 0.05, reducing it to 0.02 in a few years
attributes.background: I was watching Trust me I'm a Doctor on the BBC and the drink drive limit has not been altered since inception in 1967, despite science moving on. When it was set at 0.08, it was believed this doubled the risk of a fatal collision, it is now known to be 13 times higher.
attributes.additional_details: Road safety expert Professor Richard Allsopp, who set the original limit, states that he would now not choose that limit. He recommends a reduction to 0.05 (the same as Scotland), reducing to 0.02 in a few years (the same as the rest of Europe). He estimated that the reduction to 0.05 would save 25 lives a year. I want the Ministry of Transport to implement this and accept that the limit is currently far too high for safety. Ours is one of the highest blood alcohol limits in the world.

attributes.action: Make weekly classes  in schools about the cruel affects of bullying compulsory
attributes.background:
I am hearing all too often of children taking their own lives due to the cruel bullies making their lives a mystery.
I was bullied myself in school over 20 years ago and am shocked more hasn't been done to try to prevent it.

attributes.action: Prevent housing associations from charging tennents for essential tree work.
attributes.background: A family member of mine who lives in a housing association house had a dangerous tree in their garden. The Housing Association wanted to charge them more than £2000 to carry out the work needed to make the tree safe. I complained and won, but they continued to implement this unfair policy on others.
attributes.additional_details: Housing associations are using a loophole in the law designed for private tenants to include tree work as "standard maintenance" (along with changing bulbs) in their tenancy agreement. As the owner of the property, and therefore the tree, the housing association should be held liable for any risk posed by dangerous trees in their tenant's gardens. So forcing the tenants to pay for tree work to mitigate the risk that they (the tenant) are not responsible for is unfair and should be made illegal.

attributes.action: Allow vehicle tax to remain with the vehicle upon transfer of ownership.
attributes.background:
When the DVLA stopped issuing paper tax disc the ability to transfer vehicle tax to a new owner was also removed. 
This means that in many cases the tax is paid by both the seller and buyer for the month the car changes hands.

attributes.action: More effort to increase the peace process between Israel and Palestine
attributes.background: The UK Government should carry out a detailed review of all its efforts towards facilitating the peace process between Israel and Palestine. This review should identify what hasn’t been done and recommend new action that the Government could take.
attributes.additional_details: For so long people have seen these two states as enemies and for too long innocent people have been brought into a conflict which deeply effects the progression of life in this area of the world. It is time for this to stop.

attributes.action: Educate children and teenagers about Learning Disabilities and Mental Health
attributes.background: 1 in 4 people will have a mental health illness. 1 in 50 people have a learning disability. These figures are increasing and everyone will come into contact with people with mental health issues and learning disabilities on a regular basis. So it is important to know and understand these disorders.
attributes.additional_details: A lack of understanding and fear of the unknown is causing people with Mental Health and Learning Disabilities to become increasingly vulnerable and separated from society. To integrate everyone, including the Mental health and Learning Disability population, creating awareness and understand should decrease behaviours, such as bullying and mate crime, which is significantly higher for vulnerable people. Educating people from a young age should make these stigmatized groups more accepted.

attributes.action: Ban all forms of gambling advertisements like the banning of tobacco commercials
attributes.background: The government is not doing enough to support people that are suffering from the severity of gambling addiction. Through numerous means, gambling organisations are targeting and taking advantage of  vulnerable gambling addicts by bombarding them with the temptation to give in to their impulses.
attributes.additional_details:
For the serious addict- a slogan that says 'When the Fun Stops, Stop' on the bottom of gambling adverts is not enough to rid any real impulse. The addict that is actively working on their recovery can find a single advert on the internet or TV extremely triggering.

The government has a responsibility to protect it's citizens in the face of corporations that are tactically taking advantage of addicts, particularly where gambling is readily available with a few taps on our mobile devices.

attributes.action: Make smoking while driving illegal
attributes.background: The amount of people that have been killed in forest fires or road traffic collisions is astounding. This is all because someone throws their cigarette butt out of the window of the car. Or is not focusing while driving. I.e trying to light a cigarette.

attributes.action: Ban plastic food containers at takeaways, food pots and trays
attributes.background: According to World Environmental Forum, we have become too depended on using plastics. More than 8 million tons of it ends up in the ocean every year. If we continue to pollute at this rate, there will be more plastic than fish in the ocean by 2050,”
attributes.additional_details:
Many countries around the world have banned the use of plastics. The U.K. must take action now!

Time is up for plastic use! We must protect our ocean and the next generation!
#Banplasticuse4good #Banplasticfoodpots #Banplastictakeawayboxes

Plastic food pots and trays are often unrecyclable, say councils - http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/science-environment-45058971

attributes.action: Extend support available for care leavers doing apprenticeships beyond 24 years
attributes.background: Having worked within social care with children and families for 19 years it has saddened me that the prospects for care leavers aren't very positive. They need additional support and mentoring to access meaningful employment and often aren't ready to do this before 24 years old like their peers.
attributes.additional_details: Through maintaining contact with some care leavers I see a huge gap in supporting them appropriately into employment so that they will become financially independent and improve their personal well being in all areas. They need additional support and mentoring due the gaps and disadvantages their backgrounds have created and usually beyond the age of their peers without disadvantages. The new support available should have no upper age limit for care leavers.

attributes.action: Create a new Ministerial Department called the Department For a Fair Society.
attributes.background:
New technologies could benefit everyone but instead, they are often exploited for maximum corporate profit 
The DFFS should: 
a) Find and support technologies that can have a revolutionary positive impact on society
b) Champion them to other government departments, the press and business groups
attributes.additional_details:
Technology already exists that can break the vicious circle of poverty, give fair access to top quality education and healthcare, and end the exploitation of vulnerable people by unscrupulous business. Instead of trying to fix our broken economy, these technologies could be harnessed to create a new, ethical model that will not favour the rich over the poor or any other group over another.
The DFFS would lead the country, and the rest of the world, to a fairer, more inclusive model for society.

attributes.action: Ban the riding of bicycles while walking dogs.
attributes.background: On a regular basis, I see people riding a bicycle while they take their dog for a walk. This is highly dangerous if the dog wants to stop to do their business as on many occasions, the rider is not even paying attention to their dog, which could cause severe injury to the dog.

attributes.action: Set a legal limit on the acceptable temperature for public transport of humans
attributes.background: With death tolls in Japan this week because of soaring temperatures doesn’t the UK government think it is important to set a legal limit on what is an acceptable temperature for the public transport of humans.
attributes.additional_details: People in the UK have had to endure temperatures on the Central Line, Northern Line and from other rail operators in excess of 40 degrees. This temperature is above the legal limit for the transport of cattle and other animals, why should we as humans be any worse off. I ask the UK government to act swiftly, invest properly with Air con installation throughout all networks and bottled water provided free to all passengers during Summer months.

attributes.action: Introduce law to fine or prosecute the parents of bullies
attributes.background: Bullies have always been a problem in all schools. No action takes place because of their age, therefore they continue to bully. Parents are threatened with fines or prosecution for their child to take too much time off school, surely parents should face the same threat for their child to bully.
attributes.additional_details: Cyber bullying, bullying, threats and ABH, suicide, low self esteem. If parents get fined or threatened with prosecution each time their child bullies another, bullying will become easier to deal with. No child wants their parents to be in trouble, I think this will make the parents more inclined to help stop their child’s bullying behaviour or get help with antibullying classes. Justice for the victims of school bullying. No child deserves to be hurt physically or mentally by their peers.

attributes.action: Scrap the current school grading system and give us a result out of 100 (%).
attributes.background: Every year we get exam and test results for our children that are seemingly meaningless. The results don't tell us how much of the subject material they have actually learnt. If your child achieves a level 4C in Science, how much of the curriculum do they really know? Half? Three quarters? Who knows
attributes.additional_details: I propose two things: 1) that all tests are graded out of 100% and 2) that individual targets are scrapped. By giving us parents a simple percentage, you will be able to easily see how much of the subject your child actually knows. If they get a result of 65%, you can then decide if that's good enough for their ability or if you want them to work toward a higher grade.

attributes.action: Make a legal requirement for signs to be placed 1000m before a mobile speed trap
attributes.background: Make a legal requirement for temperary signs to be placed 1000m before a mobile speed camera. This is to insure the safety of officers who may be roadside performing speed checks. By making road users aware that officers and equipment will be near by, Drivers can make precautions when driving past.

attributes.action: Make health and nutrition a compulsory subject at Key Stage 2 and 3 level.
attributes.background: Childhood obesity is at its highest level ever in the UK and this is mainly due to a combination of lack of education in the majority of both adults and children, and misinformation spread by companies in order to sell products. By incorporating these subject in to KS2 and 3 it is providing the next
attributes.additional_details: Generation with the ability to make correctly informed choices about the foods they choose to consume.

attributes.action: Require drivers over the age of 65 to retake their driving test
attributes.background: As people get older, their reaction times may slow down and their vision may become impaired.

attributes.action: Raise Firefighters' wages to a reasonable living wage (+ all emergency services)
attributes.background: The fire fighters are real life heroes risking their own life and limb, running into danger, for the sake of others and their property. Their wages, along with ALL other emergency service workers, have been frozen and capped instead of being given the recognition they deserve.
attributes.additional_details:
Statement of a firefighter: “Personally I go to work to earn money to provide for my family and myself.  In my mind all public services work extremely hard (Police, Fire, Ambulance or our nurses and doctors).  Our pay was frozen, then capped at 1% whilst inflation has risen at about 3%, our pension contributions have risen and the NI contributions we pay so, in effect, our wages have dropped.” 

ALL emergency services deserve a decent living wage and appropriate funding for volunteer agencies.

attributes.action: Mobility scooters users should be licenced, insured and pass a handling test.
attributes.background: To help prevent more members of the general public being injured, as i was recently, by one of these large, heavy, unregulated vehicles driven without due care in public places.

attributes.action: Require every vehicle manufactured to have their lights constantly on
attributes.background: Daytime running lights also known as (Drls) are dangerous, travelling around the country I’ve seen far too many people driving at nighttime with only the vehicle drls on, which unfortunately are only on the front of vehicles.
attributes.additional_details: As a professional driver (hgv) I believe drls are very dangerous and all motor vehicles manufactured should now constantly have their lights on, best example car is the Volvo, if the switch is positioned on (0) then the headlights are still on! Several times I have been close to a collision due to this and personally I don’t think it would be fair for anyone to have an accident and potentially injure or even kill a person or family and get punished for it for the sake of making it a legal requirement that vehicle lights are constantly on.

attributes.action: Get paid for clean electricity exported to the grid
attributes.background:
Government plans to end payments for clean electricity exported from new small-scale systems from March 2019.

They propose that people give free electricity to their energy suppliers. This is unfair and will cause a huge drop in the number of installations, placing the UK solar industry at risk.
attributes.additional_details:
Two forms of payment to small-scale systems will be removed:

1. Feed in Tariff (on all electricity generated)
2. Export Tariff (on electricity sold back to the grid)

The first is a subsidy, but the second simply reflects a fair wholesale value for electricity sold to the grid.

Residential battery storage is not an economically or environmentally efficient solution. It is better to use and store solar generation at a community scale. This requires a fair price for exported clean energy.

attributes.action: Ban the import and sale of badger hair in the UK.
attributes.background: Badger hair is often used in Britain because of certain water-retaining properties it has; however, the evidence is that animals suffer, at best, appalling living conditions, and at worst, terrible abuse and neglect, in order to produce this hair.
attributes.additional_details: Badger farms, predominantly in Asia, have been filmed keeping badgers in horrific conditions in order to produce hair for items like shaving brushes and paint brushes. When other options, like horse-hair, and artificial hair, is freely available, there is no reason to support this cruel industry in any way whatsoever, and the UK should take a lead in banning the use of this commodity.

attributes.action: Lower Minimum Age of Full "A" Motorcycle License to 20 Through Direct Access
attributes.background: In 2013 the law was changed so that you could no longer get a full size motorcycle at 18 and was changed to 24
attributes.additional_details: You currently can get a full license through progressive access at 21 but that means you have to take your A1 and A2 tests before you can get it and obviously plus your CBT

attributes.action: Allow same sex male couple to have IVF on the NHS just like everyone else
attributes.background: Under the NHS A straight couple, lesbian couple and other couples are aloud to have IVF paid for by the NHS but a gay male couple isn’t aloud to have IVF funded for by the NHS.
attributes.additional_details:
Me and my husband have been wanting to do IVF but we would have to pay over £5000 to have a child. 
But if we where single or in a straight/lesbian relationship we cannot get any help from the NHS. Please help change this by signing this petition.

attributes.action: Require alcohol to be clearly labelled on food products containing it.
attributes.background: Many people boycott alcohol for religious, health beliefs & refuse to come anywhere near it if they are for example recovering alcoholics - whereas just the merest taste of alcohol could lead to fatal consequences.
attributes.additional_details:
Make CLEAR LABELLING - ALCOHOL CONTAINED MANDATORY FOR FOOD PRODUCTS.
 
Some religions boycott alcohol 
Alcoholics and other addicts cannot touch alcohol
 
Sometimes alcohol is obscurely written (mince pies / Christmas cakes etc) and not easily detected.
 
Any food product that contains alcohol or was produced with alcohol must have a big label stating alcohol was used in the production of this product.

attributes.action: Ban the use of single use plastic inside of cereal boxes
attributes.background: Most cereal comes packaged in plastic. The single use plastic bags not only are disposable and have a negative impact of our environment, but are unnecessary. Paper bags or no bags at all should be enough as the box contains all the contents.
attributes.additional_details: By stopping the use of plastic packaging inside cereal boxes, it will save the companies money, help reduce the pollution in our oceans and environment, and lower the amount of trash individuals and families produce. Alternatively, paper bags could be recycled and remade into more bags, creating a closed loop recycling system.

attributes.action: Patient transport and emergency vehicles, at all times, be allowed in bus lanes
attributes.background: Buses , taxis for profit and cycles are allowed in bus lanes. Patient transport ambulances sit in traffic so are late for essential appointments such as dialysis. Front line emergency crews waste time that could be spent responding while buses, taxis and cycles use bus lanes for convenience.
attributes.additional_details: Drive through Oxford, Reading or London for any evidence you wish to gather.

attributes.action: Make 11 November a public holiday in remembrance of the two world wars.
attributes.background: In Britain we divide our remembrance between Remembrance Sunday that takes place on the nearest Sunday to 11 November and 11 November itself which recently has gained in importance. The designation or 11 November as a public holiday would do justice to the sacrifice that we try to remember.
attributes.additional_details: Anyone who has stood under the canopy of the Menin Gate in Ypres at 8 pm and heard the last post being sounded, as it has been every evening since 1924, save for the particular circumstances of the 2nd World War, cannot fail to be moved. The designation of 11 November as a national day of remembrance and a public holiday would allow us to do justice to the sacrifice of so many that took place100 years ago.

attributes.action: Grant full time students access to a Maternity Allowance
attributes.background: Many full time students who fall pregnant or give birth during their studies, are unable to access statutory maternity pay or allowance. These are one of the few groups of women who are missing out on their maternity rights. Let’s give full time students access to maternity allowance.
attributes.additional_details:
The lack of access occurs when a student hasn’t worked in the qualifying period - you can see how that works here (see maternity allowance and statutory maternity pay): 
https://www.staffsunion.com/advice/money/financeguides/parents/

We suggest full time students should automatically have access to maternity allowance or that a special allowance be drawn up to accommodate these cases that provides equivalent support.

attributes.action: Allow Chris Brown entry into the U.K.
attributes.background: In 2010, Chris Brown was refused permission to enter the U.K. on the grounds of being guilty of a serious criminal offence. Since then, Chris Brown has paid the price for his earlier mistakes and has shown time and time again that he is a changed man through his actions and his music.
attributes.additional_details: Home office stated in 2010, “public safety is one of our primary concerns”, however, Mr. Brown poses no threat to the general public. Instead he is a source of joy to his fans, especially those in the U.K. who can only experience this vicariously through his social media presence. Therefore we ask that you please sign this petition, so our government can consider a reversal of the refusal of his entry to the U.K.

attributes.action: Make this country a true democracy.
attributes.background:
Voting for an MP or a political party involves compromise since it is unlikely that either will precisely represent an individual's views on a range of issues.
The technology now exists for people to vote easily on any popular issue but the government is currently able to ignore those wishes.
attributes.additional_details:
1)	Make the government e-petitions website more widely publicised on a regular basis, on TV for instance 
2)	Make it mandatory for the government to hold a referendum where any petition requesting a referendum exceeds 100,000 signatures
3)	Make all referendums available online
4)	Make the results of the referendums mandatory. The government MUST act on them.

attributes.action: Reconsider blood donation guidelines affecting female partners of bisexual men
attributes.background:
Currently NHS blood donation excludes female partners of bisexual men from donating blood. 

You must not give blood or platelets for at least 3 months after sex
(If you are a woman) a man who has ever had oral or anal sex with another man, even if they used a condom or other protective.
attributes.additional_details:
This excludes women whose only long term partner is a man if their partner has ever had sex with another man. Despite this, a bisexual male partner can give blood if it has been 3 months since the last instance of sexual contact with a male. Exceptions may be made if the male partner is willing or able to attend an appointment as well.

This petition requests that guidelines be reconsidered to allow women who have had sex with men who have slept with other men but not in the past 6 months.

attributes.action: Make retailers to offer unpacking, packaging collection with home delivery items
attributes.background:
The amount of packages being delivered at homes, dispatched from big warehouses.
Excessive non recyclable packaging are damaged and end in landfills and stretches the capacity of local civic body. Collection of these materials by the retailer would encourage responsible packaging and recycling.

attributes.action: Require all CCGs to offer IVF for co-parenting parents
attributes.background: Clinical Commissioning Groups (CCGs) decide IVF policies. Despite NICE stating that “the existence of living children should not be a factor that precludes the provision of fertility treatment”, this guidance isn’t mandatory and the result is a postcode lottery.
attributes.additional_details: We have recently been refused IVF by our local CCG because we are co-parents. Make it fair so IVF is available on the NHS to all co-parenting parents!

attributes.action: Government to provide further funding and resources to Veterans UK
attributes.background: Veterans UK administers the armed forces pension schemes & compensation payments for those injured or bereaved through service. In 2014, the Head of Veterans UK stated that the processing time for new claims was 4 months. In 2018, Veterans UK acknowledge that this it is now far in excess of this.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.google.co.uk/amp/s/www.walesonline.co.uk/news/wales-news/armed-forces-veterans-waiting-long-7572677.amp

https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-28656924

https://www.telegraph.co.uk/men/thinking-man/11035262/Are-we-failing-traumatised-war-veterans.html

attributes.action: Stop the closing of margate and ashford accident and emergency departments
attributes.background: There is current talk of closing qeqm and ashford accident and emergency as well as downgrading other departments such as maternity at qeqm this needs to be prevented people are going to die as a result. Having a super hospital 45 minutes away in Canterbury is not acceptable in an emergency

attributes.action: Reduce the amount of plastic used in the KS2 SATs process.
attributes.background: Governors at our school were shocked when shown the amount of plastic not only used, but also thrown away during the administration of the KS2 SATs process.
attributes.additional_details: The amount of plastic used to keep the papers secure is largely unnecessary, added to which the number of bags within bags needed for the returns process is excessive, and contrary to the current public drive to reduce such waste.

attributes.action: Make the use of mobile phones while driving an instant driving ban.
attributes.background:
As an approved driving instructor Every day i see drivers using their phones Clearly the 6 points and £200 fine have not had the desired effect to make people stop using phones while driving
I firmly believe that a three month driving ban would help greatly stop drivers using phones as they drive
attributes.additional_details: I  firmly believe that a three month driving ban would help greatly stop drivers using phones as they drive.making it difficult to get to work without a car . If  put in this position then it will make them think before using the phone while driving.
